head.title: Eddie Jordan Stays As Assistant Coach

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Basketball/National Basketball Association/New Jersey Nets

hedline.hl1: Eddie Jordan Stays As Assistant Coach

abstract.p: Eddie Jordan and Mike O'Koren to remain with New Jersey Nets as assistant coaches; Sherman Douglas exercises his option to honor final year of his contract with Nets (S)

block.p: Eddie Jordan will stay on as an assistant coach for his second year with the Nets. Jordan is expected to become Byron Scott's top assistant coach. Mike O'Koren will also stay as an assistant.

''Eddie's a terrific coach, X and O wise, he's got the trust of players and works very hard,'' said Rod Thorn, president of the Nets. ''Mike is terrific at working players out, and he also has a good relationship with them.''

''Eddie's a terrific coach, X and O wise, he's got the trust of players and works very hard,'' said Rod Thorn, president of the Nets. ''Mike is terrific at working players out, and he also has a good relationship with them.''

The free agent Sherman Douglas has exercised the option to honor the final year of his contract with the Nets. Although Kenyon Martin, the top pick in the draft, is still rehabilitating his broken leg, he is scheduled to attend the rookie camp in Boston starting July 17.
